cloudcode.welcomeViews.kubernetesNoClust:
Get started with Kubernetes in Cloud Code by adding a cluster to your KubeConfig. Clicking the button below is a good place to start, even if you don't have a cluster already.
[Add a cluster to the KubeConfig](command:cloudcode.addClusterToConfig)
Alternatively, if you already have a KubeConfig file, you can [load the file](command:cloudcode.switchKubeConfig).
cloudcode.welcomeViews.gcloudLogin:
Please login to the Google Cloud SDK to continue. If you don't have an account yet, you can get started with a [free trial](https://cloud.google.com/free).
[Login to Google Cloud SDK](command:cloudcode.gke.runGcloudAuth)
cloudcode.welcomeViews.sourceProtectLogi:
Source Protect auto scans your code for known security issues, such as vulnerabilities and license violations, as well as providing you with recommendations on how to fix them.
 Source Protect is a private preview feature. Follow the instructions in the link below to join the early access then restart VSCode for the changes to take effect.
[Join the Private Preview](command:cloudcode.sourceprotect.visit.private.preview.request)
cloudcode.welcomeViews.gcloudSelectProje:
Please select a Google Cloud project continue. If you don't have a project yet, you can create one in [Cloud Console](https://console.cloud.google.com/projectcreate).
[Select a project](command:cloudcode.sharedExplorer.chooseProject)
If you want to select a project in another account, you can [sign out](command:cloudcode.gke.gcloudSignout) and sign back in.
cloudcode.welcomeViews.explorerEnableRun:
In order to use Cloud Run on Google Cloud, you need to enable the [Cloud Run API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/run.googleapis.com).
Consuming Google Cloud APIs may incur additional billing charges. You can learn more by clicking the above link.
[Enable Cloud Run API](command:cloudcode.runExplorer.enableApi)
Alternatively, you can [switch projects](command:cloudcode.sharedExplorer.chooseProject) to a project that already has this API enabled.
cloudcode.welcomeViews.explorerEnableSec:
In order to use Secret Manager on Google Cloud, you need to enable the [Secret Manager API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/secretmanager.googleapis.com).
Consuming Google Cloud APIs may incur additional billing charges. You can learn more by clicking the above link.
[Enable Secret Manager API](command:cloudcode.secretmanagerExplorer.enableApi)
Alternatively, you can [switch projects](command:cloudcode.sharedExplorer.chooseProject) to a project that already has this API enabled.
cloudcode.welcomeViews.explorerEnableCom:
In order to use Compute Engine on Google Cloud, you need to enable the [Compute API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/compute.googleapis.com).
Consuming Google Cloud APIs may incur additional billing charges. You can learn more by clicking the above link.
[Enable Compute API](command:cloudcode.computeExplorer.enableApi)
Alternatively, you can [switch projects](command:cloudcode.sharedExplorer.chooseProject) to a project that already has this API enabled.
cloudcode.welcomeViews.explorerEnableClo:
In order to use Cloud Functions on Google Cloud, you need to enable the [Cloud Functions API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/cloudfunctions.googleapis.com) and [Cloud Build API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/cloudbuild.googleapis.com).
Consuming Google Cloud APIs may incur additional billing charges. You can learn more by clicking the above link.
[Enable Cloud Function and dependent APIs](command:cloudcode.functions.enableApi)
Alternatively, you can [switch projects](command:cloudcode.sharedExplorer.chooseProject) to a project that already has these APIs enabled.

In order to use Cloud Storage on Google Cloud, you need to enable the [Cloud Storage API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/storage.googleapis.com).
Consuming Google Cloud APIs may incur additional billing charges. You can learn more by clicking the above link.
[Enable Cloud Storage API](command:cloudcode.cloudStorageExplorer.enableApi)
Alternatively, you can [switch projects](command:cloudcode.sharedExplorer.chooseProject) to a project that already has this API enabled.
cloudcode.welcomeViews.functionsSelectPr:
You can select a project to work with Cloud Functions.
[Select a project](command:cloudcode.sharedExplorer.chooseProject)
You can [create a function](command:cloudcode.functions.create) or [open a function workspace](command:cloudcode.functions.openWorkspace) locally.
If you have already opened a function, [set this workspace as a function workspace.](command:cloudcode.functions.annotateWorkspace)
[Create function](command:cloudcode.functions.create)
cloudcode.welcomeViews.functionsGetStart:
We did not find any functions under the current project. [Select a different project](command:cloudcode.sharedExplorer.chooseProject)
You can [create a function](command:cloudcode.functions.create) or [open a function workspace](command:cloudcode.functions.openWorkspace) locally.
If you have already opened a function, [set this workspace as a function workspace.](command:cloudcode.functions.annotateWorkspace)
[Create function](command:cloudcode.functions.create)
cloudcode.welcomeViews.localDevExplorerG:
Run or debug your kubernetes app using the options in the title bar or the options below.
[Create a Kubernetes sample](command:cloudcode.createK8sAppExplorerTitle)
[Run on Kubernetes](command:cloudcode.runK8sAppExplorerTitle)
[Debug on Kubernetes](command:cloudcode.debugK8sAppExplorerTitle)
cloudcode.welcomeViews.installingDepende:
Welcome to Cloud Code! Please wait while we prepare dependencies on your machine.
Cloud Code maintains and uses a suite of best-in-class Cloud Native devtools on your machine including [Cloud SDK](https://cloud.google.com/sdk), [Kubectl](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/kubectl/kubectl/), [Minikube](https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/docs/), and [Skaffold](https://skaffold.dev/).
